result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Michael P. Allen

records.addlTxt:
Conditions: 
No contact with J.H., S.S., or their portion of the residence. 
No acts/threats of violence toward anyone. 
Defendant to maintain absolute sobriety. 
Defendant not to consume/possess any alcohol or go into any taverns, bars, liquor stores/place where alcohol is primarily served/sold.

(Case called at 11:31 AM- by Zoom) Defendant Michael Allen appears in custody via video conference from the Jail with Attorney Sonia Anderson. ADA Kelly Ronquist appears in person for the State of Wisconsin. 
Defense waives reading of the complaint. Defendant is eligible for Public Defender representation. 
Settlement Conference (by phone) with District Attorney's Office (715-839-4828) on 11/21/2022 at 3:30 PM. 
Hearing: 12/15/2022 at 9:30 AM.
